title: Rashi on II Kings
text: a jug of oil: enough oil for anointment, yet the “aleph” is part of the root like the aleph of (Job 13:17) and my speech in your ears, [Heb. וְאַחְוָתִי, from חוה], and the “aleph” of (Ezek. 21:20) the crying of [those struck down] by the sword, [Heb. אִבְחַת, from נבח], to bark.
they were bringing to her: the vessels.
amidst my relatives. No one harms me. I have need neither for the King nor for the general of the army.
“Now what can be done for her?”: to reciprocate for this favor
